data.title: David Fisher sworn-in as Wellington Township trustee
data.meta_description: David Fisher of Wellington Township was appointed to fill out the remaining term of his wife, Trustee Nancy Fisher, who resigned last month due to health reasons, according to a news release from Wellington Township.At the Oct. 5 meeting, Trustee Board Chairman Fred Pitts announced he received a resignation letter from Nancy Fisher on Sept. […]
data.text:
David Fisher of Wellington Township was appointed to fill out the remaining term of his wife, Trustee Nancy Fisher, who resigned last month due to health reasons, according to a news release from Wellington Township.

At the Oct. 5 meeting, Trustee Board Chairman Fred Pitts announced he received a resignation letter from Nancy Fisher on Sept. 9.

She resigned Sept. 18.

Pitts said he was saddened to see Nancy Fisher resign as she was an exceptional leader and steward of the Wellington Township for 12 years, the release said.

David Fisher, who is on the Nov. 2 ballot for trustee, was sworn-in to fill out the remainder of his wife’s term.

David Fisher, who grew up in LaGrange, is a graduate of Keystone High School and Lorain County Community College.

The Fishers have been married 50 years and have two children.

David Fisher is a longtime resident of Wellington Township and a dedicated public servant, the release said.

He has served on the Wellington Exempted Village school board; 20 years on the Wellington Fire Department; and several years as a member of the Wellington Kiwanis.

David Fisher, an electrical engineer, recently retired after 29 years with Forest City Technologies Inc.

He said he is looking forward to continuing his community service as a Wellington Township trustee.
